meanings.sent1: The neuronic signals in the brain help us think and feel.
meanings.sent2: The neuronic pathways in the body transmit important information.
meanings.sent3: The neuronic dance between brain cells is like a symphony of communication.
meanings.sent4: Her neuronic connections sparkled with activity like a city at night.
meanings.sent5: The neuronic activity in the brain is like a complex web of information.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the nervous system.
meanings.sent1: The neuronic response to danger triggers fight or flight instincts.
meanings.sent2: Neuronic disorders can affect the entire nervous system.
meanings.sent3: His neuronic system seemed to have a mind of its own, making him jump at unexpected sounds.
meanings.sent4: The neuronic network of the body is like a vast communication highway.
meanings.sent5: Neuronic functions keep our bodies running smoothly like a well-oiled machine.

meanings.definition: Characterized by or involving nerve cells.
meanings.sent1: The neuronic structure of the spinal cord is crucial for movement.
meanings.sent2: Neuronic activity can be measured to understand brain function.
meanings.sent3: The neuronic party in his brain was getting out of control, causing him to forget simple things.
meanings.sent4: Her neuronic connections were like bridges connecting different parts of her body.
meanings.sent5: The neuronic impulses travel at lightning speed through the nervous system.
